revision.comment: /* RFC notification */ fix link anchor target
revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=00:38, 8 March 2013 |action1link=Talk:Cooke and Wheatstone telegraph/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=542713808 |dykdate=23 February 2013 |dykentry=... that the '''[[Cooke and Wheatstone telegraph]]''' ''(pictured)'', the first [[electric telegraph]] to be put into commercial service, was initially rejected in favour of a pneumatic system with whistles? |currentstatus=GA |topic=engtech}} {{WikiProject Telecommunications|class=GA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject United Kingdom|class=GA}} == Images == [[Image:Cooke Wheatstone Telegraph 2.jpg|px200|left|frame|Telegraph received shown pointing to letter "G". "C" should be "D".]] [[User:Tabletop|Tabletop]] ([[User talk:Tabletop|talk]]) 04:15, 17 June 2009 (UTC) == Power Source == There is no information regarding the power source used for sending and receiving telegraphs. As the first power station was built in 1882 (Cooke and Wheatstone's telegram was invented in 1837) there was no electrical grid to connect the telegram to. Without explaining how the telegraph functioned this article is seriously lacking. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Iranian86Footballer|Iranian86Footballer]] ([[User talk:Iranian86Footballer|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Iranian86Footballer|contribs]]) 20:29, 13 August 2010 (UTC) :Batteries? [[Special:Contributions/86.166.71.0|86.166.71.0]] ([[User talk:86.166.71.0|talk]]) 08:51, 24 February 2013 (UTC) == Good article nomination == This article is being nominated for [[Wikipedia:Good articles|good article]] status, since it satisfies the ''good article criteria'': *Well-written: Although it is a technical article, it uses grammar and terminology that is easy for most readers to understand. It is structured according to [[WP:LAYOUT]] and other Wikipedia guidelines. *Verifiable with no original research: It has a good list of verifiable references, and these references are appropriately cited throughout the article. *Broad in its coverage: It covers not just the invention, but also information about the inventors, and the interesting related fact of how it was used to apprehend a criminal. *Neutral: There is no apparent bias. *Stable: Copyediting will undoubtedly take place, since it was just included as a [[WP:DYK|DYK]] article. *Illustrated, if possible, by images: It contains several images of the invention itself, how it us used, and of associated persons. [[User:Truthanado|Truthanado]] ([[User talk:Truthanado|talk]]) 13:11, 23 February 2013 (UTC) == DYK == Excellent article, thanks! [[User:Wizzy|Wizzy]]…[[User talk:Wizzy|'''☎''']] 14:19, 23 February 2013 (UTC) {{Talk:Cooke and Wheatstone telegraph/GA1}} ==Error in codes for I and E== Question: Why do the letters I and E in the 5 needle system have three inclined needles and not just two? Is the image correct? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/178.195.178.129|178.195.178.129]] ([[User talk:178.195.178.129|talk]]) 11:05, 26 October 2013 (UTC) :They are errors, probably from copy and paste of one code to the next. Thanks for spotting that, it should be fixed now. '''[[User:Spinningspark|Spinning]][[User talk:Spinningspark|Spark''']]''' 13:15, 26 October 2013 (UTC) == RFC notification == There is a request for comment at [[Talk:Electrical telegraph#rfc 11A12D4|Electrical telegraph]] which concerns this article. '''[[User:Spinningspark|Spinning]][[User talk:Spinningspark|Spark''']]''' 19:10, 5 January 2014 (UTC)
